<<<code>>>: try {
FileWriter writer = new FileWriter("filename.txt", true);
writer.write("Line 1");
writer.write("Line 2");
writer.write("Line 3");
writer.flush();
writer.close();
} catch (IOException e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code will open a file named "filename.txt" for writing at the beginning of the program and write three lines to it. The FileWriter.write() method is used to write the text to the file. The FileWriter.flush() method is used to flush the buffer and ensure that the data is written to the file. The FileWriter.close() method is used to close the file. You can add more lines of text to the file as needed by calling the FileWriter.write() method multiple times.
